intro: Dracaena longistyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and long, narrow leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Dracaena longistyla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
